item.title: Hex in Ruby
item.description: Hexadecimal Recently I’ve been jamming on the Cryptopals challenges in Ruby. Generally you work with the bits/data in hex. Ruby has some cool helpers to deal with hex: irb(main):004:0> string = "jackvnimble" => "jackvnimble" irb(main):005:0> bytes = string.bytes => [106, 97, 99, 107, 118, 110, 105, 109, 98, 108, 101] irb(main):006:0> bytes.map { |byte| byte.to_s(16) } => ["6a", "61", "63", "6b", "76", "6e", "69", "6d", "62", "6c", "65"] irb(main):007:0> bytes.
